# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

You can solve the problem with the following code snippet. We are using the `Dates.year` and `Dates.month` functions from Julia's standard library to extract year and month from DateTime, then we use a simple format string to concatenate them together in the desired "yyyymm" format.

```julia
using DataFrames: DataFrame, @view!

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = [DateFormat("yyyyMM")(dt) for dt in df.dt]
end
```

You can then call the function `add_yearmonth` on your dataframe as follows: 

```julia
add_yearmonth(df)
```

Make sure that you have DataFrames installed by running `Pkg.add("DataFrames")` if it is not already installed.
